message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String values = "firstname=john&lastname=fob&email=something@something.com&Telephone=3874813781";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(values, "&");
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String token = st.nextToken();
            StringTokenizer st2 = new StringTokenizer(token, "=");
            String key = st2.nextToken();
            String value = st2.nextToken();
            System.out.println(key + ": " + value);
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses the StringTokenizer class to split the input string into tokens. The first StringTokenizer splits the string at each "&" character, which separates the different parameters. Then, for each of these tokens, a second StringTokenizer is used to split the string at the "=" character, which separates the parameter name from its value. The parameter name and value are then printed out.
